text: Not really sure how he would have been working on improving his workplace behaviour when he hasn't had a workplace. And I'm guessing he didn't apologize directly to all the women he has harassed and whose careers he stunted/destroyed. https://t.co/yJAeKso8bj

Had a girl message me today demanding I apologize for confronting her so bluntly when she stalked and harassed me because “I was really mean about it.” Old me would’ve tried to see if maybe I should’ve sugar-coated some things. New me didn’t even entertain that thought process. https://t.co/gtfdzRGxOu

I know it’s the English lexicon that drives this most of the time, but people really need to learn to say “I certainly apologize to the women who went through this/experienced this/were sexually harassed” because this isn’t about what the woman felt but what the man did https://t.co/HxH40mhI7d

How about:
1. Start with an apology. 
2. Make it real. Don’t apologize to women who “felt” they were treated “inappropriately.” That’s basically saying “I’m sorry you feel like you were harassed.” 
3. Take ownership — it was your campaign, no matter the number of staffers. https://t.co/QrC96cUgS0
